content.text:
# Draft:The Peking King and the New York Queen

----
The Peking King and the New York Queen is the 9th and final track on The Doors 8th and final studio album “Full Circle” released in 1972. The song’s lyrics were written by Ray Manzarek, the band’s organist and lead vocalist after Jim Morrison passed away in 1971.
Ray Manzarek discusses the surreal culture clashes between an interracial couple, one from the Peking and one from New York.
The song features additional musicians and background vocalists including Chico Batera on percussion. Jack Conrad plays bass. Bobbye Hall is on percussion and Clydie King, Vanetta Fields, and Melissa MacKey are background vocalists.
The song is the longest of the track list for “Full Circle”, clocking in at 6:29.
According to Robby Krieger, the song was written about the marriage of Ray Manzarek and his wife Dorothy Manzarek. He stated, “That was Ray’s quintessential song about him and Dorothy.”
“The Peking King and the New York Queen” was later included on the CD reissue of “Other Voices” and “Full Circle” in 2015.
